irtrusbot

Class IrcPlugin

  • Object
    • Thread
      • IrcPlugin
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable

    public class IrcPlugin
extends Thread
    Skeleton/parent class for all IrcBot plugins If you are writing your own plugin, your plugin class should extend IrcPlugin and provide an override of the handleEvent() method. Developers should make their plugin class the "Main-Class" of their project (entry-point).
    Author:
    crash

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class Thread

        Thread.State, Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      IrcBot bot
      The bot object the plugin is attached to - Provides control over specific bot operations to the plugin.
      Properties config
      Properties for the plugin [retrieved from configDirectory/pluginname.properties] If properties are not available, this will be null
      String description
      Description string of the plugin - unused
      boolean enabled
      Whether the plugin is enabled or disabled by the Plugin Manager
      String name
      Name of the plugin - This should be set in subclasses by the constructor Generally it is suggested to use an easy to type name as this is used with IrcPluginManagerfindPlugin(name) NOTE: any Non-"word" characters [A-Za-z0-9_] will be replaced by _ during plugin initialization.
      int priority
      The priority level of the plugin This value determines the order in which the plugin receives event, and thus can filter events from being broadcast to other plugins The default value of this property is DEFAULT which receives filtered preprocessed events NOTE: plugins added with the same priority will be adjusted in priority value to maintain the order in which they were loaded.
      IrcSession session
      The IRC session object used by the bot - Provides control over the bot connection to the plugin.
      String version
      Version string of the plugin - unused

      • Fields inherited from class Thread

        MAX_PRIORITY, MIN_PRIORITY, NORM_PRIORITY

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      IrcEventAction handleEvent(IrcEvent event)
      IrcEvent message handler.
      void initialize(IrcSession sess, IrcBot b, IrcPluginManager disp)
      Method used by the Plugin Manager to set instance fields in the plugin [to provide control to the plugin] during loading.
      void loadConfig()
      Loads configuration options for this plugin into 'config' from the config file - If no properties were previously saved, this will create a blank properties object
      static void main(String[] args)
      A dummy method provided so that developers can set their plugin class as the "Main-Class" (entry-point) of their program without receiving errors.
      void postEvent(IrcEvent event)
      Post an event to all other loaded plugins in the attached Plugin Manager, if any.
      void postEventAll(IrcEvent event)
      Post an event to all other loaded plugins NOTE: this method changes the priority levels of the event to be all-inclusive.
      void postEventBot(IrcEvent event)
      Post an event to be handled by the bot rather than plugins.
      void postEventNext(IrcEvent event)
      Post an event to all other loaded plugins with the next priority number (may be in the same level) NOTE: this method changes the priority levels of the event to include all values in the range [current+1,max], including only plugins that would normally receive messages after the current plugin.
      void run()
      Method used to start plugin event handling code in a controllable Thread
      void saveConfig()
      Saves configuration options for this plugin from 'config' to the config file - If no 'config' is unset (loadConfig never called), this method will not attempt to save anything
      IrcEventAction startHandler(IrcEvent event, int max_seconds)
      Method used by PluginManager to start and time-limit plugin handling inside a thread

    • Field Detail

      • session

        public IrcSession session
        The IRC session object used by the bot - Provides control over the bot connection to the plugin.

      • bot

        public IrcBot bot
        The bot object the plugin is attached to - Provides control over specific bot operations to the plugin.

      • priority

        public int priority
        The priority level of the plugin This value determines the order in which the plugin receives event, and thus can filter events from being broadcast to other plugins The default value of this property is DEFAULT which receives filtered preprocessed events NOTE: plugins added with the same priority will be adjusted in priority value to maintain the order in which they were loaded.
        See Also:
        IrcPluginPriority

      • config

        public Properties config
        Properties for the plugin [retrieved from configDirectory/pluginname.properties] If properties are not available, this will be null

      • enabled

        public boolean enabled
        Whether the plugin is enabled or disabled by the Plugin Manager

      • name

        public String name
        Name of the plugin - This should be set in subclasses by the constructor Generally it is suggested to use an easy to type name as this is used with IrcPluginManagerfindPlugin(name) NOTE: any Non-"word" characters [A-Za-z0-9_] will be replaced by _ during plugin initialization.
        See Also:
        IrcPluginManager.findPlugin(java.lang.String)

      • version

        public String version
        Version string of the plugin - unused

      • description

        public String description
        Description string of the plugin - unused

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
        A dummy method provided so that developers can set their plugin class as the "Main-Class" (entry-point) of their program without receiving errors.
        Parameters:
        args - Program arguments (unused)

      • initialize

        public final void initialize(IrcSession sess,
                             IrcBot b,
                             IrcPluginManager disp)
        Method used by the Plugin Manager to set instance fields in the plugin [to provide control to the plugin] during loading.
        Parameters:
        sess - The IrcSession object controlling the bot connection.
        b - The Bot object instance.
        disp - The Plugin Manager object instance.

      • handleEvent

        public IrcEventAction handleEvent(IrcEvent event)
                           throws Exception
        IrcEvent message handler. This method receives Events dispatched by through Plugin Manager (by the Bot and other plugins)
        Parameters:
        event - Event being transmitted to the plugin
        Returns:
        an action value specifying how the PluginManager and Bot should continue | CONTINUE: continue to dispatch events to other plugins and take no special action | STOP_PROPAGATING: stop dispatching this event to other plugins and take no special action | CANCEL_EVENT: stop dispatching this event and attempt to cancel the action that dispatched the event (eg: sending data).
        Throws:
        Exception - An unspecified error caused by the plugin developer's code.

      • startHandler

        public final IrcEventAction startHandler(IrcEvent event,
                                         int max_seconds)
        Method used by PluginManager to start and time-limit plugin handling inside a thread
        Parameters:
        event - the event to be handled by the plugin
        max_seconds - the maximum number of seconds the thread is allowed to run
        Returns:
        an action value specifying how the PluginManager and Bot should continue (see handleEvent
        See Also:
        handleEvent(irtrusbot.IrcEvent)

      • run

        public final void run()
        Method used to start plugin event handling code in a controllable Thread
        Specified by:
        run in interface Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class Thread

      • postEvent

        public void postEvent(IrcEvent event)
        Post an event to all other loaded plugins in the attached Plugin Manager, if any.
        Parameters:
        event - Event to post.

      • postEventAll

        public void postEventAll(IrcEvent event)
        Post an event to all other loaded plugins NOTE: this method changes the priority levels of the event to be all-inclusive.
        Parameters:
        event - Event to post.

      • postEventNext

        public void postEventNext(IrcEvent event)
        Post an event to all other loaded plugins with the next priority number (may be in the same level) NOTE: this method changes the priority levels of the event to include all values in the range [current+1,max], including only plugins that would normally receive messages after the current plugin.
        Parameters:
        event - Event to post.

      • postEventBot

        public void postEventBot(IrcEvent event)
        Post an event to be handled by the bot rather than plugins. By default, events are usually handled by the bot (such as outgoing IRC commands) after plugins are allowed to process them. This method allows sending an event that will bypass most plugins. NOTE: this method changes the priority levels of the event to the range [BOT,BOT], excluding all plugins.
        Parameters:
        event - Event to post.

      • loadConfig

        public void loadConfig()
        Loads configuration options for this plugin into 'config' from the config file - If no properties were previously saved, this will create a blank properties object

      • saveConfig

        public void saveConfig()
        Saves configuration options for this plugin from 'config' to the config file - If no 'config' is unset (loadConfig never called), this method will not attempt to save anything
